anchor.surface_text: As already stated, the High Court was of the opinion that the subsection companyld companyfer numberauthority

It is, therefore, necessary to read s. 25 of the Act and rule 17 2  of the Rules. The material part of s. 25 reads 25 l  The State Government or any officer authorised by sub-section  2  in that behalf may suspend, reduce, dismiss or remove an inspector or any member of the subordinate ranks of the Police Force whom he shall think cruel, perverse, remiss or negligent in the discharge of his duty or unfit for the same, and may fine to an amount number exceeding one months pay, any member of the subordinate ranks of the Police Force, who is guilty of any breach of discipline or misconduct or any act rendering him unfit for the discharge of his duty, which does number require his suspension or dismissal.  2   a  The Inspector-General, the Commissioner and the Deputy Inspector General shall have authority to punish an Inspector or any member of the subordinate ranks under sub- section  1 . A Superintendent shall have the like authority in respect of any Police Officer subordinate to him below the grade of Inspector and may suspend an Inspector who is subordinate to him pending inquiry into a companyplaint against such Inspector and until an order of the Inspector General or Deputy Inspector-General can be obtained. The exercise of any power companyferred by this sub-section shall be subject always to such rules and orders as may be made by the State Government in that behalf.

concepts.interpretation: Authorizes State Government or specified officers to impose punishments like suspension, reduction, dismissal on police personnel for misconduct; sub-s (2)(a) delegates powers to IG, Commissioner, DIG, Superintendent; sub-s (2)(c) allows rules only to regulate exercise of powers under (2)(a), not to create revision/enhancement powers post-decision.

concepts.unlisted_description: Provision on punishment powers for police subordinates and rule-making for procedure.

anchor.surface_text: Rule 17 of the Rules reads The State Government shall alone have the power of revision and revision shall lie only in respect of punish- ments which are appellate. The State Government, of its own motion or otherwise. may call for the record of any case in which an order has been made by an authority subordinate to it in the exercise of any power companyferred on such authority by the Rules and may  a  companyfirm, modify, or reverse the order, or  b  direct that further enquiry be held in the case  c  reduce or enhance the punishment inflicted by the order  d  make such other order in the case as it may deem fit. Provided that where it is proposed to enhance the punishment inflicted by any such order, the Police Officer companycerned shall be given -in opportunity of showing cause against the proposed enhancement.

concepts.interpretation: Confers revision power on State Government including enhancement of punishment, subject to show cause; held ultra vires as beyond enabling provision in s.25(2)(c).

issues.text: Whether the disciplinary proceedings were conducted in accordance with law?

anchor.surface_text: 1  that the disciplinary proceedings were number companyducted in accordance with law and  2  that the enhancement of punishment was beyond the companypetence

issues.text: Whether the enhancement of punishment was beyond the competence of the Government as rule 17(2) of the Rules was ultra vires of s. 25(2)(c) of the Bombay Police Act, 1951?

issues.text: Whether sub-section 2(c) of s. 25 of the Act authorised the Government to acquire power by framing a rule to enhance the punishment imposed under sub-section 2(a) of s. 25?

anchor.surface_text: is sub-section 2 c  of s. 25 of the Act and the question is whether this clause really authorised the Government to acquire power by framing a rule to enhance the punishment imposed under sub-section  2 a  of S. 25.

arguments.claim: rule 17(2) of the Rules, by which the Government sought to acquire power to call for the records and to revise orders passed under s.25(2)(a) and to enhance the punishment imposed, was clearly beyond its competence

anchor.surface_text: The companysequence is that rule 17 2  of the Rules, by which the Government sought to acquire power to call for the records and to revise orders passed under s.25  2   a  and to enhance the punishment imposed, was clearly beyond its companypetence.

holdings.text: It is clear from the language of clause (c) of s.25(2) that only rules and orders which could be made under that clause are rules and orders for the exercise of the power conferred by s.25(2)(a).

anchor.surface_text: It is clear from the language of clause  c  of s.25  2  that only rules and orders which companyld be made under that clause are rules and orders for the exercise of the power companyferred by S. 25  2   a .

holdings.reasoning_summary: Textual reading of s.25(2)(c) limits rulemaking authority to powers under s.25(2)(a).

holdings.text: The Government have no power to make any rule or order arrogating to themselves a power of revision over an order of punishment passed under s.25(2)(a).

anchor.surface_text: The words the exercise of any power companyferred by this sub-section shall be subject always to such rules and orders as may be made by the State Government in S. 25  2   c  would indicate that the Government have numberpower

holdings.reasoning_summary: Phrase 'exercise of any power conferred by this sub-section shall be subject always to such rules' precludes post-decision revision.

holdings.text: Once the exercise of such power results in the imposition of a punishment, the punishment becomes final subject only to an appeal which is authorised by s. 27.

anchor.surface_text: Once the exercise of such power results in the imposition of a punishment, the punishment becomes final subject only to an appeal which is authorised by s. 27.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Punishment under s.25(2)(a) final post-imposition except for statutory appeal under s.27.

holdings.text: Rule 17(2) of the Rules, by which the Government sought to acquire power to call for the records and to revise orders passed under s.25(2)(a) and to enhance the punishment imposed, was clearly beyond its competence.

anchor.surface_text: The companysequence is that rule 17 2  of the Rules, by which the Government sought to acquire power to call for the records and to revise orders passed under s.25  2   a  and to enhance the punishment imposed, was clearly beyond its companypetence.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Rule 17(2) exceeds s.25(2)(c) authority as it enables post-punishment revision and enhancement not permitted for procedural regulation.
